formatDescription: .RIF is the native image format for the Painter software application. It includes features such as layering and  transparency. It was originally developed by Fractal Design, but is now owned and used by Corel Corporation.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: Painter RIFF Image File (pre-2000)
internalSignatures.note: The Painter RIFF format is Identified by the first 4 bytes, then bytes 8-12 which defines compression, then a static 4 bytes used in all versions at byte 40 "3F E6 66 66". The early versions identify the first 4 bytes "00 02 00 00"

internalSignatures.name: Painter RIFF Image File (2000+)
internalSignatures.note: The Painter RIFF format is identified by the first 4 bytes, then bytes 8-12 which defines compression, then a static 4 bytes used in all versions at byte 40 "3F E6 66 66". The later Corel versions (2000+) identify with the first 4 bytes "00 02 20 00".
